channel.title: xScar 2.0 (With ScarScape) + Updater
channel.description:
i thought because its java it would go in here
[B]xScar 2.0 - Including SourceCode[/B]
[B]Credits: Ollie Ruler - Reflection Grub Benland100[/B]
[B]What is it?[/B] it is a RS Client for Scar, which allows access to the clients fields undetectably
[B]Does it edit the client?[/B] Nope!
[B]How much is it?[/B] Free!
[B]Where do i get this monstrosity?[/B] [url=http://files.xnr.be/9f4c8a6c5a38f01cc1fa8db50d8fdb2f.rar]http://files.xnr.be/9f4c8a6c5a38f01cc1fa8db50d8fdb2f.rar[/url]
[B]Can i AUTO RIGHT NOW!?!?!?![/B] the Scarscape function works (never chaning colours) also input works, just send from scar mouse(x, y, left)
e.g. [code] program xScar; var Socket: Integer;
begin Socket:= OpenConnection('localhost',1337,2000);
if(Socket < 0)then Writeln('socket failed'); try SendConnectionData(Socket,'mouse(127,47,true)'); except Writeln('connection terminated'); end end. [/code]
however, what needs working on is the SCAR -> Java and vice versa. the fields are hooked, and the Reflection hacks are setup, im releasing hoping someone will finish it!
loader log: [code]Loading xScar 2.0 with SCARSCAPE Functionality Found ClientClassLoader - class c Waiting for SCAR on port 1337... Sucessfully Configured xScar 2.0 for Runescape #468 in 235ms [Grub Success-WorldX] found kc.l [Grub Success-WorldY] found r.u [Grub Success-LoopCycle] found ua.e [Grub Success-MinimapInt1] found ta.Y [Grub Success-MinimapInt2] found de.m [Grub Success-MinimapInt3] found e.A [Grub Success-CurveArrayX] found af.X [Grub Success-CurveArrayY] found af.P [Grub Success-LoginIndex] found tb.g [Grub Success-PlayerX] found ce.j.dc [Grub Success-PlayerY] found ce.j.dc [Grub Success-PlayerAnimation] found ce.j.ub [Grub Success-PlayerMoving] found ce.j.eb [Grub Success-PlayerCurrentHP] found ce.j.lc [Grub Success-PlayerMaximumHP] found ce.j.Ub [Grub Success-PlayerHeight] found ce.j.W [Grub Success-PlayerLoopCycleStatus] found ce.j.Z[/code]

item.title: xScar 2.0 (With ScarScape) + Updater
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_Olan14 I Am Olan14
item.description:
@I_Am_Olan14 wrote:

[quote=“1337h4x, post:17, topic:132861”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=184113.msg1671941#msg1671941 date=1187039845]
the whole point was to use scar as an input generator, the idea is absurd and an attempt to aid a crippled cheat
[/quote]ya srsly. Plus pascal/delphi wtf? That’s the most random language ever.[/quote]

Tell me about it.
Why make a ALGOL based Programming Language?
It’s the ugliest base language I’ve ever seen.

Read full topic

item.title: xScar 2.0 (With ScarScape) + Updater
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

I’m not saying my XML scripting is any better than SCAR, because tbh, it really sucks. But regardless, for this implementation, SCAR just grabs coordinates and such then pumps them into this client, which could really be done by a lot of things, one of which happens to be pascal based scriptable colour clicker.

Read full topic

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:29, topic:132861”]Pretty much gay to run a 64-bit windows operating system you mean? I agree

<3 Ferty[/quote]
Ill burn your apartment and you entire 3 pieces of furniture down sir, anyways JNI looks to prove interesting.
Anyways it uses a dll file so you cant knock me for being booted into windows, and I believe in utilizing your system resources kay thanks

Read full topic

item.title: xScar 2.0 (With ScarScape) + Updater
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:27, topic:132861”]Interesting Ollie, it is nice to see people releasing things. If someone is going to finish this I would suggest an alternate way of communicating with SCAR though, sockets are ugly, shared memory is less ugly, and JNI would be the best way.

If anyone wants to mess with shared memory, have a look at regex’s original archive:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/Java_sharedmem_Scar.rar[/quote]

yea, i was concidering JNI, but i have never used it before.

i need to fix this up aswell its not complete… im fixing it up and releasing to SRL Member only i think lol

Read full topic

item.title: xScar 2.0 (With ScarScape) + Updater
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Interesting Ollie, it is nice to see people releasing things. If someone is going to finish this I would suggest an alternate way of communicating with SCAR though, sockets are ugly, shared memory is less ugly, and JNI would be the best way.

If anyone wants to mess with shared memory, have a look at regex’s original archive:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/Java_sharedmem_Scar.rar

Read full topic
